intro: Gymnanthes actinostemoides, commonly known as the star-stemmed gymnanthes, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures and latex-producing properties. The plant features a short, woody stem with a distinctive star-shaped arrangement of branches, giving it its common name. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly pubescent surface. The flowers are small and clustered, typically yellow or green, and are surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia.
